tetra.logic

Class Tetra

  • java.lang.Object
    • tetra.logic.Tetra
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, EventListener

    public class Tetra
extends Object
implements ActionListener
    Implements game logic, which updates game state according to the rules of the game. The game is updated as a function of time, the current state of the game, and user actions. This class handles most of the work by delegating it to supporting classes.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tetra(Matrix matrix, Piece piece, RandomTetromino random)
      Class constructor which specifies the matrix and piece for this game.

      Returns the user interface component registered to be notified of changes to game state.

      Returns a listener that has registered to be notified when the game ends.

      Returns the piece of this game.
      RandomTetromino getRandom()
      Returns the random generator of this game.
      int getTimerDelay()
      Returns the current delay between periodic game state updates, which dictates the speed of descent.

      Drops the piece as far down as possible, then respawns the piece.

      Returns true if the game has ended.
      boolean isSoftDropActive()
      Returns true if the piece is in a mode of accelerated descent.

      Registers a listener to be notified when the game ends.

      Starts the game, after which game state will update at regular intervals.
      void startSoftDrop()
      Increases the speed of descent, until told otherwise.
      void stop()
      Stops the game.
      void update()
      Updates game logic, and notifies the user interface that it should update itself.

        public void start()
        Starts the game, after which game state will update at regular intervals.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the game. After this this game instance should be disposed.

        Returns the current delay between periodic game state updates, which dictates the speed of descent.

        public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)

      • update

        public void update()
        Updates game logic, and notifies the user interface that it should update itself.

      • hardDrop

        public void hardDrop()
        Drops the piece as far down as possible, then respawns the piece. The movement of the piece is instantaneous.

      • startSoftDrop

        public void startSoftDrop()
        Increases the speed of descent, until told otherwise.

      • endSoftDrop

        public void endSoftDrop()
        Resumes the ordinary speed of descent.

      • isSoftDropActive

        public boolean isSoftDropActive()
        Returns true if the piece is in a mode of accelerated descent.
        Returns:
        true if currectly active, false otherwise

      • isGameOver

        public boolean isGameOver()
        Returns true if the game has ended.
        Returns:
        true if the game has ended, false otherwise

      • getGameOverListener

        public UpdateListener getGameOverListener()
        Returns a listener that has registered to be notified when the game ends.
        Returns:
        registered listener

      • setGameOverListener

        public void setGameOverListener(UpdateListener gameOverListener)
        Registers a listener to be notified when the game ends. The listener will receive at most one notification.
        Parameters:
        gameOverListener - listener to be registered
